message: Hey guys, thought I'd put this here, wondered how much of a limit the 120 word answer limit is on YC apps, what's your experience. At the moment I have some serious cutting down to do and wondered where I should definitely aim under 120 or it's more of a guide.
Judging from the way YC treats its soft rule of having more than one founder, I would try very hard to be within the limit.
I didn't know about that. Wow!
I'd do as they instruct unless otherwise told so by a YC partner.
It shows clarity of thought in addition to being faster to process

Exactly! Get something on paper, revise it, have someone give honest feedback, revise it, then try to read it as if you were PG -- he's got N bajillion applications, and only 40-odd slots, so why does this app stand out? If you ramble, you'll be passed over.
Keep it at the same level of intensity. 120 words of precision and insight is different to 120 words of fluff. They are looking for the former.
Yeah good advice, thanks guys, I tend to write on the verbose side of things so definitely need to spend some time cutting back and rewording.
